title: TTU rides Toppin gem to upset of No. 1 Arizona
content: Texas Tech's JT Toppin finished Saturday's upset overtime win vs. No. 1 Arizona with 31 points, 13 rebounds, three assists, two steals and a block.

title: Silver considering all fixes for NBA's tanking issue
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver called tanking the worst it has been in "recent memory" and said he's not ruling out any potential remedy, including taking away draft picks, to stop overt tanking.

title: Dame claims 3rd title; Johnson wins dunk contest
content: Damian Lillard, nine months after undergoing surgery on his torn Achilles, won his third All-Star 3-point contest to tie with Larry Bird and Craig Hodges for the most ever.

title: Anthony Kim stuns for LIV Golf Adelaide crown
content: American Anthony Kim, who has overcome alcohol and drug addiction, has charged to an emotional win at LIV Golf's Adelaide tournament.

title: Sources: MAC to add Sac State for football in '26
content: The MAC presidents have voted to formally add FCS Sacramento State into the league as a football-only member starting in 2026, sources told ESPN.

title: Eichel, Tkachuk rally unbeaten U.S. past Denmark
content: The U.S. men's Olympic hockey team rode its top line to a 6-3 win over Denmark and remain tied with also-unbeaten Canada going into the final day of the preliminary round.

title: UConn, UCLA top projected women's top 16 seeds
content: UConn, UCLA, South Carolina and Vanderbilt are the projected No. 1 seeds in the women's NCAA tournament, it was announced Saturday.

title: Sources: Raiders promoting Leonard to DC
content: The Raiders are promoting run game coordinator/defensive line coach Rob Leonard to defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

content: Our experts break down what to watch over the 2026 NBA All-Star Weekend and their picks for contests, competitions and more.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Mikaela Shiffrin and USA men's hockey back in action and more from Milan Cortina
content: Sunday at the Winter Olympics includes Mikaela Shiffrin trying to win gold in the giant slalom, Erin Jackson defending her 500m speedskating gold and USA men's hockey taking on Germany.

content: Impress your friends by repeating ESPN's easy-to-learn fun facts about the Great American Race ahead of this year's edition of the Daytona 500.

content: Mohamed Salah turning in a memorable performance in front of an adoring Anfield crowd? No, it's not 2024, but it sure felt like it on Saturday night in Liverpool.

content: Jumping over cars -- and Shaq -- wins fans but doesn't translate into the talents recruiters want to see

content: The Last Four In and First Four Out groupings feature teams with big wins -- and high potential for March.

content: The selection committee's first reveal of the season leaned into head-to-head, but the metric isn't the only answer.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

content: The French team's victory in ice dance at the Winter Olympics has drawn criticism for a number of reasons. We break it down.

content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Stones' quest for World Cup, new Man City deal begins with win over Salford
content: John Stones returned from a three-month injury layoff on Saturday, the first step toward earning a World Cup place and a new Man City contract.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid squash Arsenal, Chelsea Endrick hopes
content: Endrick had to leave Madrid in search of minutes, but now that he's succeeding on loan at Lyon, Real want him back. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Indian-origin student found dead in US: Friend says he 'stopped caring about life' ‚Äî What we know
content: A 22-year-old Indian postgraduate student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, from the University of California, Berkeley, has been found dead. His body was recovered from Lake Anza by authorities after a days-long search. The Indian Consulate in San Francisco confirmed the recovery and is providing support to his family.

title: 'If the opposition doesn't allow the House to function, we will go for the guillotine': Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will be debated and voted on March 9. The second part of the Budget session, starting the same day, is expected to be "interesting" with crucial legislation. Rijiju warned that continued opposition protests could be detrimental to them and suggested potential cracks in opposition unity.

title: China's secret nuclear expansion: New warhead facilities detected in Sichuan mountains
content: Satellite imagery reveals significant expansion and upgrades at China's nuclear weapons facilities in Sichuan Province, including new bunkers and a plutonium pit production site. This modernization effort, accelerating since 2019, aims to bolster China's superpower status and potentially deter US intervention in future crises, particularly concerning Taiwan.

title: Madras HC judge recuses self over allegation lawyer took Rs 50 lakh to bribe him
content: A Madras High Court judge recused himself from a CBI case after an allegation surfaced that a senior advocate took ‚Çπ50 lakh from a client for a favorable order. The judge referred the matter to the vigilance cell, citing the seriousness of the representation received from the All India Lawyers' Association for Justice.

title: 'I want rain': Ex-Pakistan player gives shocking IND vs PAK verdict
content: Rain threatens the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Colombo, with forecasts predicting heavy showers and storms. Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali shocked fans by saying he wants rain. A minimum of five overs per side is needed for a result; otherwise, the match will be abandoned and both teams get one point, likely helping both qualify for the next round.

title: The Sunday call where Steve Jobs told Google their logo was 'just wrong'
content: Back in January 2008, Steve Jobs called Google's Vic Gundotra on a Sunday morning‚Äîwhile Gundotra was in church‚Äîto complain that the second 'O' in Google's iPhone icon had the wrong yellow gradient. Jobs had already assigned an Apple engineer to fix it by Monday.

title: 15-year relationship, one WhatsApp text: What led to Noida‚Äôs Valentine‚Äôs Day car murder
content: A man and woman were found dead with gunshot wounds in a locked car in Noida, with police initially suggesting suicide due to a pistol found in the man's hand. However, the man's family alleges murder due to caste-related threats, while the woman's family claims past harassment and recent marital arrangements due to caste differences.

title: Anthropic CEO tells US govt 'not to do' what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' for
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk. He argues that while AI's economic benefits should be shared globally, critical compute power must remain out of authoritarian hands. Amodei believes this approach is crucial for maintaining global stability and preventing misuse of AI technology.

title: G20-like security setup for AI summit in Delhi; bomb squads, 500 CCTVs to guard venue
content: In preparation for the AI Impact Summit in Delhi, a comprehensive security operation is in full effect, incorporating cutting-edge anti-drone technology and an extensive network of over 500 high-definition CCTV cameras. With 5,000 traffic officers deployed, each hotel housing VIPs will be guarded by a dedicated team of 100 personnel.

title: West Bengal voter list may shrink by 68 lakh from 2024 Lok Sabha polls
content: Bengal's voter count is set to decrease by approximately 68 lakh, a significant 9% drop from the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Following a special revision, over 58 lakh absent, shifted, or deceased voters were initially removed. Further exclusions are expected due to unaddressed discrepancies and non-appearances for hearings, potentially impacting the final electoral roll.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: 'Time to end Islamic republic': Reza Pahlavi urges Trump to help Iranian people
content: Reza Pahlavi, son of Iran's last shah, has appealed to US President Donald Trump. He called for an end to the Islamic republic, stating it is the demand of the Iranian people. Pahlavi asked Trump to help Iranians, referencing the President's earlier remarks about change in Iran. Trump has increased military pressure on the Islamic republic.

title: Mumbai metro mishap: 5 arrested, Rs 6 crore fine imposed ‚Äî what triggered the parapet failure?
content: Five individuals, including project directors and managers from RAJV-Milan Infra and DB-Hill-LBG consortium, were arrested after a Metro Line 4 parapet segment collapsed, killing one and injuring three. MMRDA imposed penalties on contractors and consultants, while politicians highlighted previous violations and safety concerns. An inquiry committee has been formed to investigate the incident.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Vijay and Rashmika wedding: Big south stars on guest list
content: Wedding bells are ringing for Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna, with reports suggesting an intimate February 26th ceremony in Udaipur. A grand Hyderabad reception is planned for March 4th, expecting a star-studded guest list. The couple reportedly rejected a massive Rs 60 crore streaming offer for their wedding, prioritizing privacy for the event.

title: Diving turns dangerous: Oman issues warning after man swims with killer whale
content: Oman's Environment Authority has issued a stern warning against diving near orcas following a viral video of a man swimming close to the powerful marine predators. The advisory emphasises the unpredictable nature and immense strength of these wild animals, stressing that such close encounters pose serious risks to both human lives and wildlife wellbeing.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: No need to question tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra anymore, says IO
content: Police investigating a Lamborghini crash in Kanpur stated no further interrogation of accused Shivam Kumar Mishra is needed, as all required questioning was completed at his arrest. Mishra, son of a local businessman, was granted bail hours after his arrest, with the court directing his cooperation in the ongoing investigation.

title: Watch: Photos framed, prayers offered at Kanpur temple before IND vs PAK match
content: Fans in Kanpur prayed for India‚Äôs victory ahead of the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Colombo. India and Pakistan have started the tournament strongly, with India dominating past T20 World Cup meetings and having a strong record at the venue. The match is scheduled for Sunday at 7 PM IST, but rain could affect play, with forecasts predicting showers during the day.

title: Did Jeffrey Epstein use Nobel glam to entice global elites?
content: Jeffrey Epstein leveraged his connections with Thorbjorn Jagland, former head of the Nobel Peace Prize committee, to impress influential figures like Bill Gates and Richard Branson.  Files reveal Epstein frequently mentioned Jagland's visits, sparking interest among elites.  Jagland now faces corruption charges in Norway following the document release.

title: Bangladesh invites 13 nations, including India, to BNP govt swearing-in; who‚Äôs on the list
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, is set to form a new government following a landslide victory in the 2026 general election. Leaders from 13 countries have been invited to the swearing-in ceremony, signaling the party's inclusive foreign policy. The BNP expressed gratitude for PM Modi's congratulatory message and looks forward to constructive engagement with India.

title: Horrific accident in Bengaluru: 5 dead as speeding car collides head-on with bus
content: A tragic road accident near Jindal on Tumakuru Road claimed five lives late Saturday night when a speeding car crashed into a divider, veered into oncoming traffic, and collided head-on with a KSRTC bus. Four car occupants died instantly, and the critically injured driver later succumbed. The bus was carrying 42 passengers, with a few sustaining minor injuries.

title: 'Jana Nayagan': No date before April 2026 for Vijay's film
content: Vijay's final film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces further delays, now pushed past April 30, 2026, according to Canadian distributor York Cinemas. This latest setback follows earlier certification issues. Meanwhile, Vijay's 2016 hit 'Theri' will now re-release on February 20, offering fans a consolation.

title: Barack Obama says aliens are 'real', but rules out Area 51 conspiracy
content: Former US President Barack Obama has publicly stated his belief in the existence of aliens, though he admits he has no concrete evidence or knowledge of their whereabouts. He dismissed theories about Area 51, emphasizing that no such secrets are hidden from the President.

title: Hardik Pandya is the Atum of Indian cricket: 'Hope we remember what he's done on field'
content: Hardik Pandya‚Äôs journey mirrors self-creation ‚Äî rising from obscurity to become India‚Äôs white-ball MVP while battling scrutiny, injuries and perception. Backed by mentors like Kieron Pollard, he has turned chaos into control, proving his resilience repeatedly. Beyond the flash lies a cricketer defined by reinvention and an unrelenting will to succeed.

title: Getting first house in UAE? 5 real estate trends home owners should focus on
content: UAE's property market is seeing a surge in first-time homebuyers in 2026, driven by government support and a shift towards long-term value. Buyers now prioritise build quality, practical design and community infrastructure over speculation. Affordability and tech-driven mortgage solutions are making ownership more accessible, fostering a generation committed to homeownership as a lifestyle choice.

title: What‚Äôs in a name, if we can‚Äôt make it ‚Äòours‚Äô? Indians and their delicious dialect of food
content: A viral video of a boy mispronouncing 'croissant' as 'prashant' sparked a humorous trend, with Britannia even renaming its product. This highlights a common phenomenon in India where foreign food names are often adapted, reflecting a unique way of embracing new cuisines. Similarly, regional Indian dishes also face pronunciation variations, showcasing a blend of linguistic adaptation and cultural engagement.

title: T20 WC: When, where and how to watch IND vs PAK on TV and online?
content: The India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup 2026 match will be played on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Both teams started strongly, with India dominating early and Pakistan recovering well. India has historically dominated Pakistan in T20 World Cups and has a strong record at this venue. Rain may affect the game. The match starts at 7 PM IST and will be broadcast on Star Sports and streamed on JioHotstar.

title: ‚ÄòBurning eyes, breathing trouble‚Äô: Yogi Adityanath likens Delhi‚Äôs air to ‚Äògas chamber‚Äô
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed concern over Delhi's poor air quality, likening it to a gas chamber and a result of environmental neglect. He contrasted this with Gorakhpur's clean atmosphere, highlighting a proposed forestry university as a long-term solution to environmental challenges and public health issues.

title: ‚ÄòThey said they would parade me naked‚Äô: Woman YouTuber alleges assault ‚Äî how scuffle unfolded at DU
content: A woman YouTuber alleged she was assaulted and nearly abducted during a protest at Delhi University, claiming caste-based targeting. A student group, AISA, denied the allegations, stating their members were targeted instead. Police have registered two FIRs based on complaints from both sides.

title: Double murder at Bengaluru villa: At parents‚Äô last rites, accused techie shows no emotion
content: Rohan Chandra Bhat, accused in the murder of his parents, attended their funeral in Bengaluru. He was brought from Nimhans for the ceremony. His sister Rashmi Bhat, who flew in from the US, also participated. Rohan, appearing detached, performed rituals briefly under tight security. The family and friends expressed shock and disbelief at the tragedy.

title: IND vs PAK: India captain SKY mimics Pakistan's Usman Tariq - Watch
content: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav copied Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq‚Äôs unusual bowling action during practice before the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match, and the video went viral. Rain forced India to train indoors in Colombo. Tariq‚Äôs sidearm action and delayed release have made him a major talking point, despite limited experience. Suryakumar called him an ‚Äúout of syllabus‚Äù challenge and said India is preparing special methods to counter him.

title: Divided by conflict, Meiteis and Kukis unite on a football field
content: Keithelmanbi lies along the seam where the Imphal Valley rises into the surrounding hills, a geography that has hardened into buffer zones and guarded perimeters. The teams were named after nearby villages. But even a distance of 4km can carry more meaning than it suggests.

title: IND vs PAK: What if rain washes out Sunday's T20 WC game?
content: The India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Colombo faces a rain threat. Both teams started well, and India has dominated past T20 World Cup meetings. At least five overs per side are needed for a result; otherwise, both teams get one point. A washout would cause major financial losses for broadcasters, organisers, and Sri Lanka Cricket due to lost ads and ticket refunds.

title: 22-year-old IIT Madras grad found dead in US, was missing for 6 days
content: A 22-year-old Indian student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, pursuing a Master's at UC Berkeley, has been found deceased. Reported missing on February 12th, his body was recovered by local police, confirmed by the Consulate General of India, San Francisco. Consular officers are providing full support to his family, including arrangements for repatriation.

title: Bangladesh polls: BNP wants PM Modi, Saarc leaders at Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony
content: PM Modi will be invited to the swearing-in ceremony of the new govt in Bangladesh led by BNP chief Tarique Rahman, who wants to engage constructively with India. Senior BNP functionaries indicated that Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif and other heads of govt of Saarc countries will also be invited.

title: Happy Maha Shivratri 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Maha Shivratri offers a unique, quiet devotion, symbolizing faith, strength, and surrender. Millions observe this night of prayer and reflection, with many fasting and offering prayers to Lord Shiva. The festival provides a much-needed pause in busy lives, reminding devotees of inner peace and the enduring power of faith, offering comfort and hope.

title: Noida: Ex-Lovers found dead in locked car, gun recovered; last whatsapp message hints at fallout
content: A man and woman were found dead from gunshot wounds inside a locked car in Noida, with police investigating a murder-suicide. A message on the man's phone suggests he killed his ex-girlfriend before taking his own life. Both families had filed missing person reports prior to the discovery.

title: How Epstein secured visas, sham marriages for women in his trafficking network
content: Newly released US Department of Justice files reveal Jeffrey Epstein exploited student visas, English schools, and marriages to manage women's immigration status. He sponsored language programs and pursued work visas, even arranging a marriage for one woman to secure permanent residency and citizenship.

title: Assam government has written to Centre for more emergency landing facilities: Himanta
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that the state government will ink a pact with the Civil Aviation Ministry to carry out a study to construct four more airports at Majuli, Diphu, Umrangso and Manas

title: Caste row over Dalit woman‚Äôs engagement at anganwadi centre in Odisha resolved, says official
content: The anganwadi centre will function normally from February 16, as the parents consented to send their children, Sujata Nayak, member of State commission for protection of child rights, said

title: Two involved in shooting at migrant labourers in Punjab's Moga held after encounter
content: Two migrant labourers were injured after three unidentified assailants on a motorcycle allegedly opened fire at a group of workers in the district on February 10

title: Bangladesh seeks reset in India ties, onus on New Delhi to recognise changed reality: Tarique's Advisor
content: Bangladesh has invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi and several other regional leaders to attend the swearing-in ceremony of the country's next Prime Minister, Tarique Rahman

content: It was found that one of them procured MDMA from an unknown person in Bengaluru through social media and later sold it in Mysuru

content: Due to the impact of the collision, the front portion of the bus was damaged and left a few passengers seated in the front rows with minor injuries

content: On March 9, in the Lok Sabha, we will have the debate on the no-confidence motion moved against the speaker. It is the rule to take it up on the first day. There will be a vote following the debate, says Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju

title: AI adoption leading to moderation in entry-level hiring: Report
content: Gen AI is primarily functioning as a productivity-enhancing complement to technical and analytical work, rather than a substitute, the report said

content: The purpose of Ms. Sasikala‚Äôs ongoing discussion is to finalise her camp‚Äôs strategy for the 2026 Assembly election;¬†she has planned to hold discussion up to February 18, says her follower who is a former legislator.

content: Charthawal police station SHO Satyanarayan Dahiya told reporters that the accused has been identified as Jitendra Kumar Kashyap

content: Air quality in the city was recorded in the 'poor' category at 9 a.m., with an Air Quality Index (AQI) reading of 210, Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data showed.

title: Munich Security Conference: Jaishankar meets Ukrainian counterpart Andrii Sybiha
content: We also covered cooperation within international organisations and reaffirmed our mutual interest in further contacts, expanding trade, and deepening bilateral ties, says  Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha in a post on X

content: In Kashmir, lakes and rivers sustain a vibrant fishing culture that blends livelihood, tradition, and cuisine; seasonal rhythms and deep-rooted culinary heritage is preserved by the local community

content: Passengers at the station noticed flames engulfing the coach, triggering a brief commotion on the platform

title: Vice-President, PM Modi extend Mahashivratri greetings
content: Vice-President Radhakrishnan and PM Modi wish the nation prosperity and blessings on Mahashivratri, celebrating India‚Äôs spiritual tradition

title: Three militants, including two women, arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested two women cadres of the banned outfit People's Liberation Army (PLA) from the vicinity of Sunrise Ground in Tengnoupal district

title: India ‚Äòvery successful‚Äô emerging economy; right place to host AI summit: UN Chief Guterres
content: Mr. Guterres asserted ‚Äúit would be totally unacceptable that AI would be just a privilege of the most developed countries or a division only between two superpowers‚Äù, an apparent reference to the U.S. and China

content: The 2.064-km circuit showcased thrilling competition and impressive stunts, while Speed Demons Delhi set a high standard for future races

content: PM Modi is expected to decline the invitation, as he will be in Mumbai for bilateral talks with French President Emmanuel Macron, and then will chair the AI impact summit in Delhi

title: Ensure zero human death in elephant attacks: Jharkhand CM asks officials
content: Man-elephant conflicts in Jharkhand have left as many as 474 people dead since the 2019-20 fiscal, according to a government report

title: Owaisi demands action against YouTubers targeting vendor at Medaram Jatara
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi demanded the Telangana Police book cases against those who harassed the vendor

content: Saketh Sreenivasaiah, a student at the University of California, Berkeley, hailing from Karnataka, had been missing since Monday (February 9, 2026)

content: On Thursday (February 12, 2026), the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) said the probe was still in progress and no final conclusions have been reached

title: Meta to cut pay outs to fact-checking partners in India
content: Two people with knowledge of discussions with the social media company told The Hindu that the firm planned to cut payments to professional fact checkers it has paid since 2016 by a third to half

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin inspects ongoing work on sports complex in Tirupattur
content: The new complex will have a spectator‚Äôs gallery with a seating capacity of over 3,500 to watch football games and athletic events

title: Love and its newfangled terms
content: Married couples in India are, reportedly, increasingly opening themselves up to alternative relationship models and structures, often in pursuit of authentic happiness and trust. Perceived for long as conservative, it seems Tamil Nadu is not entirely so. Some of the cities are now accommodating ethical non-monogamy ‚Äî very simply, a relationship involving many and with consent. Preeti M.S.¬†syncs up with married couples in Tamil Nadu to explore these new trends

title: Ahead of State budget, resident welfare associations demand focus on civic infrastructure
content: The Alliance of Resident Welfare Associations has called on the GCC to allocate funds in the interim Budget for a technical audit and rectification of stormwater drains, restoration of roads, and completion of pending infrastructure works

title: Found in translation
content: As Parliament adds interpreters in over 20 Indian languages, the small group of people who translate speeches and other proceedings simultaneously as business unfolds in the two houses tell Aroon Deep about the emerging field

content: The remarks by WB BJP president Samik Bhattacharya, which come ahead of the Assembly polls in the State, marks a significant departure from the earlier stand of the saffron party where it did not engage with minorities.

title: State level wrestling tournament begins in Bihar
content: Commonwealth Games gold medallist shooter and sports minister Shreyasi Singh asserted that the dream and goal is to ensure the participation of as many players from Bihar as possible in the Olympics in the future.

title: After couple found dead in Noida, man's family alleges murder, caste-based threats by woman's kin
content: The couple allegedly received taunts from the woman's family, and the man's family had received threats, including calls from international numbers warning of police action

title: 3,058 voters to be removed from final voter rolls in Ernakulam as SIR hearing comes to a close
content: Exclusions include deceased voters, those who have permanently shifted from the district, and persons who have relinquished Indian citizenship

title: As Bangladesh Shifts To Elected Government, Is It Going To Be President Yunus?
content: As Muhammad Yunus's term as Chief Adviser of the Interim Government of Bangladesh comes to an end, speculation is growing about what role he may take up next.

title: Couple Married For 58 Years Seeks Divorce. Court Says No. Here's Why
content: The Rajasthan High Court refused to dissolve a 58-year-old marriage between an elderly couple, saying that minor arguments and disagreements cannot be treated as cruelty.

title: India To Build Its 1st Underwater Road-Rail Tunnel At Rs 18,000 Crore
content: India has approved a Rs 18,662-crore project to build a four-lane access-controlled greenfield corridor between Gohpur and Numaligarh, featuring India's first road-and-rail tunnel under the Brahmaputra river in Assam.

title: Video: 'Show ID' - Pak Army Chief Asim Munir Nearly Stopped At Munich Event
content: A security officer at an event in Germany's Munich almost stopped Pakistan Army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir over his identity card.

title: All-Weather Road To Cut Through Rajaji National Park, Commercial Vehicles Won't Be Allowed
content: The Supreme Court modified its earlier stay order and allowed metalling of the 11.5-km Laldhang-Chillarkhal road in Uttarakhand to benefit thousands of people of the state's 18 remote villages.

title: Yogi Adityanath Says Delhi 'Like A Gas Chamber', Praises UP's Environment
content: Likening the air quality of the national capital to a 'gas chamber', Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath asserted that people in Uttar Pradesh enjoy a clean environment and are not being suffocated, despite all the developmental work.

title: What Anil Ambani, Jeffrey Epstein Discussed Over Meals At Luxury Home
content: Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani's correspondence with the convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein shows both discussed a range of topics from how to fund a business to trade in the defence sector.

title: France's Emmanuel Macron To Meet PM Modi On February 17 During India Visit
content: French President Emmanuel Macron will arrive in Mumbai on February 16 during his upcoming visit, where he will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi on February 17.

title: Who Was Saketh Sreenivasaiah, IIT Madras Graduate Found Dead In California
content: A 22-year-old Indian student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, was found dead in California six days after he went missing. Saketh, who was pursuing his master's degree at the University of California, Berkeley, had disappeared on February 9.

title: Union Minister Says Ahmedabad Air Crash Probe Still Underway, Refutes Foreign Media Report
content: Union Minister of State for Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol has refuted a foreign media report about the probe into the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad last year, stating that the investigation is still going on.

title: Fresh Firing Reported In Manipur's Ukhrul District, Police Appeal For Calm
content: Fresh firing was reported on Saturday at the Litan Sareikhong area in Manipur's Ukhrul district, allegedly by Tangkhul Naga village volunteers, triggering panic and tension among local residents, police said.

title: Noida's Valentine's Day Murder: Bodies With Gunshots In Car, A WhatsApp Note
content: A young man allegedly shot his girlfriend dead and then shot himself inside a car in Noida on Valentine's Day. Police found both bodies with gunshot wounds, along with a pistol and cartridges recovered from the vehicle.

title: Indian Student Found Dead 6 Days After He Went Missing In California
content: A 22-year-old Indian student was found dead in California six days after he went missing, prompting police and the community to launch a citywide search.

title: Israel To Attend India AI Impact Summit 2026, Strengthen Tech Ties
content: In a display of growingcollaboration in artificial intelligence and emerging technologies,a high-level Israeli delegation will be participating in the India AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled to be held in New Delhi from February 16 to 20.

title: How BharatGen Is Building India's Sovereign AI Future
content: As artificial intelligence redraws the global balance of power, India has quietly but decisively entered the foundational layer of this transformation.

title: PM Modi Receives Invite For Tarique Rahman's Oath Ceremony On February 17
content: Dhaka is set to witness a major political moment on February 17 as Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairman Tarique Rahman is sworn in as the next Prime Minister of Bangladesh, marking the formal return of the BNP to power.

title: 'Bangladesh First': Tarique Rahman's Reply To Query On Ties With India
content: After a sweeping victory in the 13th National Parliamentary Elections, Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chief Tarique Rahman, in a press conference, said that Bangladesh's foreign policy will prioritise the country's interests over others.

title: ICE Continues Illegal Detentions Despite 4,400 Court Rulings Against Them
content: Hundreds of judges around the country have ruled more than 4,400 times since October that President Donald Trump's administration is detaining immigrants unlawfully, a Reuters review of court records found.

title: "They Have Faith In You": Crown Prince Calls On Trump To Help Iranians
content: The exiled son of Iran's last shah called on US President Donald Trump on Saturday to help the Iranian people, a day after the American leader said a change of power would be the "best thing".

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026

title: Two games, two wins: Grades, big questions after Team USA's dramatic win over Denmark
content: the game was much more dramatic than many had predicted, but the result was a 6-3 win for the united states over Denmark . team USA trailed 2-1 after the first period, before roaring back to score three in the second . the netminder allowed three goals on just 12 shots, one being a center-ice strike by rugged Danish league defender Nick Jensen .

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?

title: USA defeats Denmark 6-3: Top moments from Olympic men's hockey
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) After a commanding  5-1 win  over Latvia, the United States men's hockey team was back in action for Game 2 of the preliminary round in the 2026 Olympics. Saturday's game was against Denmark, which lost 3-1 to Germany in its first game. The United States won, 6-3. The U.S. now sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Center  Brock Nelson  led the U.S. in scoring after one game, with two goals, while forwards  Jack Eichel ,  Jack Hughes ,  Matthew Tkachuk  and defenseman  Quinn Hughes  all had two assists. Forwards  Auston Matthews ,  Tage Thompson  and  Brady Tkachuk  were the other goal scorers in the opening contest. More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings

title: How UCLA's softball star decided to join the basketball program
